p: Various breeds were represented with median weight 9.3kg (range 5.95‐14.3) and age 8.75years (range 3‐11.5). The median duration of clinical signs was 28days (range 5‐183). 7/8 dogs failed conservative therapy prior to surgery. The commonest clinical sign was ambulatory tetraparesis (4/8). Diagnostic investigations consisted of MRI in all cases and CT in 4/7cases. The intervertebral spaces most commonly affected were C3/4 and C5/6 (3/8cases). Long term, 5/8cases demonstrated an improvement in clinical signs. There was no significant difference in distraction index immediately post‐op and at 6‐8weeks.
